cheatsheet.title: Creating, Running and Exporting a JAX-WS Service

description.b: This cheat sheet shows you how to create, run, and export a JAX-WS Service JAR

item.title: Creating a JAX-WS Service Provider Project
item.description:
1. Click File > New > Project.... > Swordfish > JAX-WS Service from Java. Click Next.
2. In the next window, type a name for your project in the Project name field.
3. Click Next.
4. In the Content window, clear the Generate an activator, a Java class that controls the plug-in's lifecycle check box.
5. Click Next.
6. In the JAX-WS Service Options window, you can change the name of the service.
7. Click Finish. The new project is now visible in your workspace.

item.title: Running a JAX-WS Service Plug-in Project
item.description:
1. Right click your JAX-WS Service Provider Project.
2. Click Run As > Run configuration....
3. Select OSGi Framework > Swordfish.
4. Click Run.
5. Open the following URL to view the services that are running: http://localhost:8197/.

item.title: Exporting a JAX-WS Service JAR as a Deployable Plug-in
item.description:
1. Select the project
2. Click File > Export Plug-in Development > Deployable plug-ins and fragments and click Next.
3. Select the target directory to which the JAR must be exported. Click Finish.
4. Check the created JAR file.
